chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The GfxView plugin allows users to display a picture file in a dedicated panel. It has been written because some friends were developing machine tools programs with jEdit but did have to open another application nearby to display tool layout drawings.
For those who likes to have a picture of their family while working, this is another way of doing it :-)

chapter.title: Commands
chapter.para: The application can be used within several entries :

listitem.para: Using Display Picture in plugin menu of FileSystemBrowser
Using Plugin>GfxView :
Display a remote picture which opens a dialog box where you specify a valid URL
Choose from history which shows a liste from you can choose from your previous entries (default : 10)
Display previous from history which allows to step back in history
Display next from history which allows to step forward in history
Using loadImage function in a BeanShell macro
path is either a filepath or a http url

chapter.title: The gfxview panel
chapter.para: There is a dockable panel where pictures are displayed that will appear everytime user will choose a picture. This panel has 3 buttons for zooming, unzooming and restoring original size. User has the possibility to move picture within area with Left-Click pressed. USer can also draw a zoom window while maintening Ctrl key pressed. While Ctrl+Left-Click increases zoom level, Ctrl+Shift+Left-Click decreases it

listitem.para: It shows only files formats recognized by ImageroReader library (JPG/PNG/TIF/BMP). Previously it only supported Java JRE native formats (PNG/JPG).
